summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting discovery materials under a protective order. The letter details the designation of the materials and references a specific control number and index.

persons.name: Damian Williams

persons.context: Recipient of the letter as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

connections.description: Everdell is listed as counsel for Maxwell in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
Cohen is listed as counsel for Maxwell in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Production in Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, governed by a protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential materials.

keyFacts: The document is a formal discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
The produced materials are subject to a specific protective order dated July 31, 2020, with designated paragraphs governing confidentiality.
The materials are stamped with the control number SDNY_GM_02775781 and include an index, with one listed item being a 'Letter from DriveSavers'.

The Department of Justice directed the office to cease using the word 'confidential' on materials to avoid confusion with classified document markings, leading to a new labeling system referencing the protective order paragraphs.
